name: Avoid Procedures with more than N lines of code  (RPG400)
description:
This rule searches all the procedures having more than N lines of code.
N is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists RPG400 Procedures with more than N lines of code.
It provides the following information:
RPG400 Procedure full name
rationale: Maintainability of the code is facilitated if procedures and thus programs are not too big.
remediation: Review the source code in order to have procedures with less than N lines of code.
alternativeName: Avoid Procedures with more than N lines of code  (RPG400)

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
